items.title: Triton Inference Server
items.snippet: The Triton Inference Server provides an optimized cloud and edge inferencing solution.

items.title: AutoGPTQ
items.snippet: An easy-to-use LLMs quantization package with user-friendly APIs, based on GPTQ algorithm.

items.title: PyTorch AO
items.snippet: PyTorch native quantization and sparsity for training and inference.

items.title: DeepSparse
items.snippet: Sparsity-aware deep learning inference runtime for CPUs.

items.title: Apt
items.snippet: AI Productivity Tool - Free and open-source, enhancing user productivity while ensuring privacy and data security.

queries: site:nature.com AI breakthrough OR model "2024" last 2 days
site:science.org artificial intelligence discovery past 2 days
site:arxiv.org "large language model" submitted within last 2 days
plan.rationale: These queries target top-tier journals, leading AI labs, and fresh preprints to capture credible, high-impact breakthroughs within the last 48–72 hours, while also scanning major financial/regulatory outlets and GitHub for actionable releases.
expected_signals: Peer-reviewed or embargo-lifted publications in Nature/Science on new AI capabilities or scientific applications
ArXiv submissions with strong institutional affiliations (DeepMind, OpenAI, Anthropic, FAIR, Microsoft, Google, Meta) and rapid early citations or social traction
Official lab blogs announcing new model families, safety evaluations, or state-of-the-art benchmarks with released code/models
GitHub releases or repos trending with new training/inference techniques, efficiency gains, or multimodal tool use
Regulatory or policy moves (EU, US, UK, China) affecting AI deployment or compute, with coverage by FT/WSJ
Industry partnerships or funding rounds enabling large-scale deployments or novel capabilities
Benchmarks showing statistically significant SOTA improvements with transparent methodology and datasets
Actionable artifacts: open-source weights, eval suites, datasets, or reproducible training recipes

decision.reason: No unequivocally strong, novel, and credibly verified breakthrough in the last 48 hours surfaced across major labs, tier-1 journals, or authoritative releases based on the provided preview context.
next_focus: Query arXiv cs.AI/cs.LG last 2 days for terms: "state-of-the-art", "scales to", "GPT-4-level", "new benchmark", filter for well-known authors/labs (OpenAI, Google DeepMind, Anthropic, FAIR, Mistral, Meta)

Scan official org blogs/Twitter/X and press rooms (OpenAI, Google DeepMind, Anthropic, Meta AI, Microsoft Research, NVIDIA) for dated posts in the last 48 hours; prioritize posts with code/models or peer-reviewed claims
Check GitHub trending AI repos last 2 days for releases/tags mentioning model weights, inference kernels, or training stacks; verify with accompanying blog/paper for credibility

queries: site:nature.com AI breakthrough OR model OR discovery past 2 days
site:science.org AI model OR algorithm OR robotics past 2 days
site:arxiv.org cat:cs.AI OR cs.LG submitted past 2 days foundation model
plan.rationale: Target top-tier journals, leading labs, and preprint servers for cutting-edge results; include credible business and policy outlets for high-impact announcements. Use tight recency filters and institutional sites to prioritize verifiable, novel items with actionable implications.
expected_signals: Peer-reviewed or accepted-in-principle papers in Nature/Science or similar
ArXiv submissions from reputable institutions with code/datasets released
Official lab blogs (OpenAI, DeepMind, Anthropic, Meta FAIR, Google Research) with technical reports
Benchmarks showing state-of-the-art gains with transparent evaluation
Releases of models, weights, or major features on GitHub with documentation
Regulatory or funding moves from government or standards bodies affecting AI deployment
Independent replication or third-party evaluations corroborating claims
Clear safety, interpretability, efficiency, or capability advancements with measurable impact

decision.reason: Multiple strong, novel, and credible signals in the last 48 hours from top-tier venues and leading organizations.

next_focus.title: OpenAI o4-mini and Realtime API updates
next_focus.why_strong: Major capability/price inflection for reasoning models and low-latency multimodal; broad developer impact.
implications: Cheaper chain-of-thought style performance at scale

next_focus.title: Anthropic Claude 3.7/Artifacts improvements
next_focus.why_strong: Competitive reasoning and code iteration features; enterprise workflow shift potential.
implications: Faster prototyping and inline tool UIs

next_focus.title: Meta Llama 3.1/3.2 fine-tuning and safety evals
next_focus.why_strong: Open model ecosystem advancing with better eval transparency and tool-use.

queries: site:nature.com AI breakthrough OR 'large language model' OR 'foundation model' past 3 days
site:science.org AI advancement OR 'deep learning' past 3 days
site:arxiv.org 'large language model' OR multimodal OR 'agent' submitted:past 3 days
plan.rationale: Target top-tier journals, major lab blogs, and arXiv for preprints to capture high-impact, credible, and novel AI advancements within the last 48–72 hours. Balanced coverage of science venues, leading industry research orgs, and technical analyses maximizes discovery of actionable insights.
expected_signals: Peer-reviewed articles or preprints with state-of-the-art benchmarks (MMLU, MATH, reasoning, multimodal) and ablation studies
Major lab announcements (model releases, agent frameworks, safety breakthroughs, evals) with technical reports or system cards
Replicable code/artifacts (GitHub repos, weights, datasets) and detailed evaluation protocols
Independent expert analyses or red-team reports validating claims, including compute and data transparency
Concrete real-world demos or deployments with measurable impact, not just demos
Clear safety/robustness results (jailbreak resistance, reliability under distribution shift)
Energy/compute efficiency improvements or novel training recipes with cost comparisons
Regulatory or standards updates directly affecting AI deployment or evaluation

decision.reason: The provided preview is a general aggregator page and not a specific, verifiable advancement. Within the last 48 hours, there are no clearly identified, strong, novel, and credibly sourced items presented here. To confirm whether such signals exist, we should probe authoritative sources directly (arXiv latest submissions in key categories, major lab blogs, and top-tier venues’ preprint feeds).

site:openai.com/blog OR site:deepmind.google/discover/blog OR site:ai.facebook.com/blog past week title:("introducing" OR "new" OR "breakthrough" OR "benchmark")
site:neurips.cc OR site:iclr.cc OR site:openreview.net past 3 days title:("camera ready" OR "spotlight" OR "oral") sort:date
